original: Ekman, Carl Josef, direktör, Göteborg, f. 9/3/70 i Ocke^bo, Gävleb. ’!., av ’teol. dr Jakob E. o. Mark-Louise Sjöström. G. 25 m. Martha Ewatz. — Avg: ex. fr. Schartaus hand :inst. 88. Res. i de nord. l|änderna samt Engl., Ty^skl. Frankr., Itail. o. Ryssl. Anst. v. trävarukont. i London 89-92, chef f. firma C. J. Ekman & Co. i London 92-03, verkst. dir. i C. J. Ekmans A-B i Gbg. Led. av stadsfullm. i Gbg 11-26, fd. ordf. i fisk-hamnsdeleg., torg- o. saluhallsstyr. o. i styr. f. sjöm :hemm., ordf. i Angb. A-B Ferm, i s^tyr. f. BTOStrömiska stift., fd. v. ordf. i Riksfören. f. svenskh. be v. i utll., hed:llled. där isied. 3(4, hed:-led. i foilkpartiets Gbgs-avd., led. av riksd. andra kamm. (1) 33-36. RNO, RVO, RBKrO.
translated: Ekman, Carl Josef, director, Gothenburg, b. 9/3/70 in Ockebo, Gävleborg County, son of "teol. dr" (theologian doctor) Jakob E. and Mark-Louise Sjöström. Married on 25th with Martha Ewatz. Graduated from Schartaus Handelsinstitut in 1888. Resided in Nordic countries, as well as England, Germany, France, Italy, and Russia. Employed as a timber agent in London from 1889-1892, executive director of C.J. Ekman & Co. in London from 1892-1903, managing director of C.J. Ekmans A-B in Gothenburg. Member of the Gothenburg city council from 1911-1926, former chairman of the fishing harbor delegation, market and auction hall committees and the board for seamen's homes, chairman of Angb. A-B Ferm, board member of BTOStrömiska Stift., former vice chairman of the National Association for Swedish Emigration, honorary member there since 1934, honorary member in the People's Party's Gothenburg branch, member of the second chamber of parliament from 1933-1936. Received the Order of the North Star, the Royal Order of Vasa, and the Royal Order of the Polar Star.

awards.name: Royal Order of the Polar Star
